## Description {#details}

This file defines the PointerUnion class, which is a discriminated union of pointer types.

<Link id="l00091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="91"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This is a forward declaration of CastInfoPointerUnionImpl</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="92"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Refer to its definition below for further details</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="93"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">template</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &lt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">typename</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">... PTs&gt; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">struct </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">CastInfoPointerUnionImpl;</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="94"><Highlight kind="comment">/// A discriminated union of two or more pointer types, with the discriminator</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="95"><Highlight kind="comment">/// in the low bit of the pointer.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="96"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="97"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This implementation is extremely efficient in space due to leveraging the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="98"><Highlight kind="comment">/// low bits of the pointer, while exposing a natural and type-safe API.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="99"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="100"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Common use patterns would be something like this:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="101"><Highlight kind="comment">///    PointerUnion&lt;int&#42;, float&#42;&gt; P;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="102"><Highlight kind="comment">///    P = (int&#42;)0;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="103"><Highlight kind="comment">///    printf(&quot;%d %d&quot;, P.is&lt;int&#42;&gt;(), P.is&lt;float&#42;&gt;());  // prints &quot;1 0&quot;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="104"><Highlight kind="comment">///    X = P.get&lt;int&#42;&gt;();     // ok.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="105"><Highlight kind="comment">///    Y = P.get&lt;float&#42;&gt;();   // runtime assertion failure.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="106"><Highlight kind="comment">///    Z = P.get&lt;double&#42;&gt;();  // compile time failure.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="107"><Highlight kind="comment">///    P = (float&#42;)0;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="108"><Highlight kind="comment">///    Y = P.get&lt;float&#42;&gt;();   // ok.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="109"><Highlight kind="comment">///    X = P.get&lt;int&#42;&gt;();     // runtime assertion failure.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="110"><Highlight kind="comment">///    PointerUnion&lt;int&#42;, int&#42;&gt; Q; // compile time failure.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="111"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">template</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &lt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">typename</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">... PTs&gt;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="112" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/pointerunion"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/pointerunion/#a026920b196771d8a451c6868d1c1bda8">PointerUnion</a></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="113"><Highlight kind="normal">    : </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">public</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/pointer-union-detail/pointerunionmembers">pointer&#95;union&#95;detail::PointerUnionMembers</a>&lt;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="114"><Highlight kind="normal">          PointerUnion&lt;PTs...&gt;,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="115"><Highlight kind="normal">          PointerIntPair&lt;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="116"><Highlight kind="normal">              void &#42;, pointer&#95;union&#95;detail::bitsRequired(sizeof...(PTs)), int,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="117"><Highlight kind="normal">              pointer&#95;union&#95;detail::PointerUnionUIntTraits&lt;PTs...&gt;&gt;,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="118"><Highlight kind="normal">          0, PTs...&gt; &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="119" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/pointerunion/#a70028a6e275a60bdc2b207ee8e6b0ab6"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static&#95;assert</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">(<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/typesaredistinct">TypesAreDistinct</a>&lt;PTs...&gt;::value,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="120"><Highlight kind="normal">                </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;PointerUnion alternative types cannot be repeated&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="121"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The first type is special because we want to directly cast a pointer to a</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="122"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// default-initialized union to a pointer to the first type. But we don&#39;t</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="123"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// want PointerUnion to be a &#39;template &lt;typename First, typename ...Rest&gt;&#39;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="124"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// because it&#39;s much more convenient to have a name for the whole pack. So</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="125"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// split off the first type here.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="126"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">using </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">First = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ac6f1a6a977a36412e8334968f89437a4">TypeAtIndex</a>&lt;0, PTs...&gt;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00127" /><CodeLine lineNumber="127"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">using </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">Base = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">typename</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> PointerUnion::PointerUnionMembers;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00227" /><CodeLine lineNumber="227"><Highlight kind="comment">/// &#96;&#96;&#96;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00228" /><CodeLine lineNumber="228"><Highlight kind="comment">/// The compiler complains &#39;Partial specialization cannot be declared as a</Highlight></CodeLine>
